Setup VM Ubuntu 16.04 Xenial with default settings
Install docker:
	- sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://p80.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-keys 58118E89F3A912897C070ADBF76221572C52609D
	- sudo apt-add-repository 'deb https://apt.dockerproject.org/repo ubuntu-xenial main'
	- sudo apt-get update
	- apt-cache policy docker-engine
	- sudo apt-get install -y docker-engine
install docker-compose:
	- sudo apt install docker-compose

docker-compose run --rm loraserver bash
source /etc/lsb-release
sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv-keys 1CE2AFD36DBCCA00		(thanks Brendan: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Desktop-Linux-Windows-Web-Player/Can-t-install-public-key/td-p/91153)
sudo echo "deb https://repos.loraserver.io/${DISTRIB_ID,,} ${DISTRIB_CODENAME} testing" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/loraserver.list
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:mosquitto-dev/mosquitto-ppa
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install mosquitto
sudo apt-get install redis-server
sudo apt-get install loraserver

sudo apt-get install vim	(just for me)

sudo systemctl [start|stop|restart|status] loraserver
journalctl -u loraserver -f -n 50

example on how to start loraserver:
loraserver --net-id "010203" --band "AU_915_928"

Made configurations to config file
config file: /etc/default/loraserver

sudo apt-get install postgresql

sudo -u postgres psql

create role loraserver with login password '********';

create database loraserver with owner loraserver;

sudo apt-get install lora-app-server

sudo systemctl start lora-app-server

sudo apt-get install lora-gateway-bridge	# probably should have done this before...


23/03/2017: sudo apt-get update, sudo apt-get upgrade
edited /etc/default/lora-app/server, JWT_SECRET is required to launch lora-app-server

To Run:
sudo systemctl start lora-gateway-bridge
sudo systemctl start loraserver
sudo systemctl start lora-app-server
go to localhost:8080
